/* eslint-disable no-unused-vars */ import React, { useState, useEffect } from "react"; import { Link, useParams } from "react-router-dom"; import axios from "axios"; import { Play, BookOpen, Clock, Users, Star, ChevronDown, ChevronRight, Check, Lock, } from "lucide-react"; const Learning = () => { const { id } = useParams(); // Get course ID from URL const [activeLesson, setActiveLesson] = useState(0); const [videoProgress, setVideoProgress] = useState(0); const [courseData, setCourseData] = useState(null); const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); const [error, setError] = useState(null); const videoRef = React.useRef(null); useEffect(() => { if (id) { fetchCourseData(); } }, [id]); const fetchCourseData = async () => { try { setLoading(true); const token = localStorage.getItem('token'); if (!token) { setError('Please log in to access this course.'); setLoading(false); return; } // Fetch course data from your API const response = await axios.get(`http://localhost:5000/api/courses/${id}`, { headers: { 'Authorization': `Bearer ${token}` } }); setCourseData(response.data); setError(null); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching course data:', error); setError('Failed to load course data. Please try again.'); } finally { setLoading(false); } }; const handleTimeUpdate = () => { const video = videoRef.current; if (video && video.duration) { const progress = (video.currentTime / video.duration) * 100; setVideoProgress(progress.toFixed(0)); // round to integer } }; // Sample course data (fallback for when API data is not available) const currentCourse = courseData || { id: id || 1, title: "Complete React Development", instructor: "Jane Smith", rating: 4.8, students: 15420, duration: "12 hours", level: "Intermediate", progress: 65, thumbnail: "https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1633356122544-f134324a6cee?w=400&h=225&fit=crop", description: "Master React from basics to advanced concepts including hooks, context, and performance optimization.", modules: [ { title: "Getting Started with React", lessons: [ { title: "Introduction to React", duration: "15:30", completed: true, }, { title: "Setting up Development Environment", duration: "12:45", completed: true, }, { title: "Your First React Application", duration: "18:20", completed: true, }, ], }, { title: "React Components & JSX", lessons: [ { title: "Understanding Components", duration: "22:15", completed: true, }, { title: "JSX Syntax and Best Practices", duration: "16:40", completed: false, }, { title: "Props and State Management", duration: "25:30", completed: false, }, ], }, { title: "Advanced React Concepts", lessons: [ { title: "React Hooks Deep Dive", duration: "28:45", completed: false, }, { title: "Context API", duration: "19:20", completed: false }, { title: "Performance Optimization", duration: "24:10", completed: false, }, ], }, ], }; if (loading) { return (
Loading...

); } if (error) { return (

{/* Learning Outcomes */}
Learning Outcomes
  • Master React fundamentals and JSX
  • Understand component-based architecture
  • Work with hooks like useState and useEffect
  • Manage global state with Context API
  • Build, deploy, and optimize real-world apps
{/* Course Tags */}
Tags
React Hooks Frontend JSX Web Development
{/* What You'll Learn */}
What You'll Learn
  • Build modern React applications from scratch
  • Master React components, props, and state management
  • Learn React Hooks including useState, useEffect, and custom hooks
  • Understand JSX syntax and best practices
  • Implement Context API for global state management
  • Optimize React applications for better performance
  • Handle forms and user input validation
  • Work with APIs and handle asynchronous operations
  • Implement routing with React Router
  • Deploy React applications to production

); }; export default Learning;
